intro: Rumfordia media, commonly known as the broad-leafed krameria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are adapted for animal dispersal. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, Rumfordia media is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
